p: Levels of hydrogen peroxide in the green peach aphid significantly increased at 24 h and 48 h after application of S. chamaecyparissus EO ( Figure 2). For the bird cherry-oat aphid tissues, a significant increase in hydrogen peroxide generation was observed at 12 h after treatment with EO from S. chamaecyparissus, and at 24 h and 48 h for both of the applied EOs. The highest increase for S. chamaecyparissus EO was noted after 48 h of exposure (115%) and for T. patula EO after 24 h of exposure (80%). It is also worth noting that the observed increase in hydrogen peroxide content was much higher in R. padi than in M. persicae.
